A4.text: Pakistan was heavily involved in creating the Taliban in 1994.

A5.text: The Taliban's roots lie in the religious schools of Kandahar and were influenced significantly by foreign support, particularly from Pakistan and Saudi Arabia, during the Sovietâ€“Afghan War.

A6.text: The Taliban emerged in September 1994 as a movement and militia of students (talib) from Islamic madrassas (schools) in Pakistan, who soon had military support from Pakistan.
